interactions:
Kayako - ticket id 60011782 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear ATLAS,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with the journaling mailbox not connecting and emails not archiving. We understand the urgency of the situation and are here to assist you.

To help us resolve this issue more efficiently, could you please provide the following information:

- Have you attempted to connect the journal mailbox as per the instructions in this article: Configuring a Journaling Mailbox [https://gfi-archiver-supportdesk.kayako.com/article/106317-configuring-a-journaling-mailbox]?
- If you are using Office 365, did you follow the steps outlined in this article: Configuring EWS OAuth Authentication with GFI Archiver [https://gfi-archiver-supportdesk.kayako.com/article/106310-configuring-ews-oauth-authentication-with-gfi-archiver]?
- If the journal mailbox connection shows no error in Archiver, please refer to this article: Archiver Not Consuming Emails from the Journal Mailbox on Exchange Online [https://gfi-archiver-supportdesk.kayako.com/article/105303-archiver-not-consuming-emails-from-the-journal-mailbox-on-exchange-online].
- Have you shared the server logs as per the instructions in this article: Gathering Troubleshooter Logs for Archiver [https://gfi-archiver-supportdesk.kayako.com/article/106126-gathering-troubleshooter-logs-for-archiver]?
- What is the specific error message displayed when attempting to connect the journaling mailbox?

Please provide this information at your earliest convenience. If you need more time, rest assured that the ticket will remain open for one additional week.

Sincerely,
ATLAS
GFI - Archiver Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Closed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you.

Michelle Donnelly:

Chat Support:

 Thank you for providing more information about your issue with ticket #60010193. I understand that the journaling mailbox is not connecting and emails are not being archived. This is a serious concern, and I'll be happy to guide you through some troubleshooting steps.

First, let's verify a few important settings:

1. Journal Mailbox Connection:
- Navigate to Configuration > Mail Servers to Archive
- Select the Journal Mailbox and click Edit
- Complete the wizard and verify that the connection test is successful
- Ensure the journal mailbox is set to Active

2. Journaling Configuration:
- Confirm that journaling is enabled for all Microsoft Exchange databases and working correctly in Microsoft Exchange

3. Archive Store Summary:
- Go to Configuration > Archive Stores
- Click Summary of the active archive store
- Check the Last Email Archived On date and time

If you've already checked these settings and the issue persists, we can try the following:

1. Restart GFI Services:
- Open services.msc and restart all GFI-related services

2. Journal Mailbox Access:
- Confirm you can access the journal mailbox through OWA or Outlook
- If you can't access it, the account might be locked out in Active Directory or the credentials may be incorrect

3. Check Journal Mailbox Content:
- If no emails are in the journal mailbox, verify that journaling is enabled for the appropriate mailbox type
- If emails are stuck in the journal mailbox, check the total size of emails and attachments

If these steps don't resolve the issue, we may need to gather more information:

1. Collect troubleshooting logs
2. Provide information on the type of Journal Mailbox configured
3. Specify the type of database in use

If you've already tried these steps or need further assistance, please let me know, and we can escalate this to our support team for a more in-depth investigation.

-------------------------

For more details check:
👉 Archiver not archiving emails [https://support.archiver.gfi.com/article/106311]

I'll stay here in case you need anything else 😀
